text: - Removed the deprecated [`AbstractClassInstantiationError`][] error. It was made
context: a compile-time error to call the constructor of an abstract class in Dart 2.0.

text: - Removed the deprecated [`CyclicInitializationError`]. Cyclic dependencies are
context: no longer detected at runtime in null safe code. Such code will fail in other

text: - Removed the deprecated [`NoSuchMethodError`][] default constructor.
context: Use the [`NoSuchMethodError.withInvocation`][] named constructor instead.

text: - Removed the deprecated [`BidirectionalIterator`][] class.
context: Existing bidirectional iterators can still work, they just don't have

text: - Removed the deprecated [`DeferredLibrary`][] class.
context: Use the [`deferred as`][] import syntax instead.

text: - Deprecated the `HasNextIterator` class ([#50883][]).
- Removed the deprecated [`MAX_USER_TAGS`][] constant.
context: Use [`maxUserTags`][] instead.

text: - Removed the deprecated [`Metrics`][], [`Metric`][], [`Counter`][],
context: and [`Gauge`][] classes as they have been broken since Dart 2.0.

text: - Deprecate `NetworkInterface.listSupported`. Has always returned true since
context: Dart 2.3.

text: Use [`Deprecated.message`][] instead.
context: - Removed the deprecated [`CastError`][] error.

text: Use [`TypeError`][] instead.
context: - Removed the deprecated [`FallThroughError`][] error. The kind of

text: Use [`maxUserTags`][] instead.
context: - Callbacks passed to `registerExtension` will be run in the zone from which

text: now takes `Object` instead of `String`.
- On Windows the `PUB_CACHE` has moved to `%LOCALAPPDATA%`, since Dart 2.8 the
context: `PUB_CACHE` has been created in `%LOCALAPPDATA%` when one wasn't present.

text: - Observatory is no longer served by default and users should instead use Dart
context: DevTools. Users requiring specific functionality in Observatory should set

text: > There is no immediate problem but is related to a deprecation. Since `flutter pub run` was deprecated in favor of `dart run`, the built in task command in the extension should be updated to use `dart run`.
> **#5728**: Use `flutterRoot` instead of looking for the `flutter` package when reading the sdk path from `.package_config.json` `is enhancement`
context: > **Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

text: > **#5830**: Switch to LSP client v10.0.0-next.18 and enable delayOpenNotifications `is performance`
context: > Fixes https://github.com/Dart-Code/Dart-Code/issues/5176

text: > **#5801**: Use "package:foo" instead of foldernames in command execution `is enhancement` `in commands`
context: > Fixes https://github.com/Dart-Code/Dart-Code/issues/5789

text: * [#5775](https://github.com/Dart-Code/Dart-Code/issues/5775): The Flutter Widget Preview now works for _all_ projects within a Pub Workspace instead of only the first.
> **#5730**: Wish to inform the user to prefer USB over WiFi when developing against an iOS 26 device `is enhancement` `in flutter` `in debugging` `relies on sdk changes`
context: > Related to https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/176206

text: * [#5744](https://github.com/Dart-Code/Dart-Code/issues/5744): The Flutter Widget Preview sidebar icon now appears after extension activation instead of only after the widget preview server initialises.

[#5334](https://github.com/Dart-Code/Dart-Code/issues/5334)/[#5377](https://github.com/Dart-Code/Dart-Code/issues/5377)/[#5117](https://github.com/Dart-Code/Dart-Code/issues/5117): [@davidmartos96](https://github.com/davidmartos96) contributed new settings `dart.getFlutterSdkCommand` and `dart.getDartSdkCommand` that allow executing a command to locate the Dart/Flutter SDKs to use for a workspace. This improves compatibility with some SDK version managers (such as `mise` and `asdf`) because they can be queried for the current SDK instead of reading from `PATH` (or `package.json`).
> **#5311**: Switch customDevTools to assume `dt` instead of `devtools_tool` `is enhancement` `in devtools`
context: > See https://github.com/flutter/devtools/pull/8410

text: > **#5231**: Switch to parsing the new Flutter version file `bin/cache/flutter.version.json` instead of the legacy one `version` and remove workaround `is enhancement`
context: > See:

text: > **#5225**: Switch to the DTD sidebar when using a new enough SDK `is enhancement` `in flutter sidebar`
context: > - DevTools work done in https://github.com/flutter/devtools/commit/faeb2a3e0d49a01301ed85dd9bba989a88b4b762

text: * [#4877](https://github.com/Dart-Code/Dart-Code/issues/4877): The hover for `Enum.values` no longer incorrectly reports the type as `Enum` instead of `List<Enum>`.

* [#4966](https://github.com/Dart-Code/Dart-Code/issues/4966): The `dart.previewSdkDaps` setting has been replaced by a new `dart.useLegacyDebugAdapters`. The new setting has the opposite meaning (`true` means to use the legacy adapters, whereas for the old setting that was `false`).
> Flutter users should run `flutter pub get` instead of `dart pub get`.
> **#4377**: Switch to VS Code's telemetry classes `is enhancement`
context: > https://code.visualstudio.com/updates/v1_75#_telemetry

text: * [#737](https://github.com/Dart-Code/Dart-Code/issues/737): A new setting `"dart.addSdkToTerminalPath"` enables automatically adding your current SDK to the `PATH` environment variable for built-in terminals. This works with quick SDK switching and ensures running `dart` or `flutter` from the terminal matches the version being used for analysis and debugging. To avoid losing terminal state, VS Code may require you to click an icon in existing terminal windows to restart them for this change to apply (this is not required for new terminals). This setting is opt-in today, but may become the default in a future release.

> Flutter recently added an option to `flutter create` to create an empty project that doesn't have any comments, the code is just a hello world instead of the counter app, and there's no test directory.  The flag is `--empty`.
